title: Search - Offline indicator overlaps with skeleton loader in the search router

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.1-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/69638 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** djsdinjoijsdoinsj@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.expensify.com 2. Go offline. 3. Go to Account > Troubleshoot. 4. Click Clear cache and restart > Reset and refresh. 5. Press CMD+K to open search router. 6. Close it. 7. Press CMD+K to open search router. ## Expected Result: In Step 5, offline indicator will appear on the search router the first time it is opened. In Step 7, offline indicator will not overlap with the skeleton loader. ## Actual Result: In Step 5, offline indicator does not appear on the search router the first time it is opened. In Step 7, offline indicator overlaps with the skeleton loader. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b3685db9-9d29-4b0b-8699-442a58d319b5 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @QichenZhu

title: Chat - Attachments never fully download and displayed error  "Attachment not found"

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @JmillsExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#expensify_quality](https://https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1748013453884369) ## Action Performed: 1. Receive an attachment and view it in the web app 2. Switch to the mobile app and I limit the network speed to EDGE 3. The image doesn't load, it can't be downloaded (it shows the error that was sent above by Jason) 4. Restart the app (still on EDGE network) and it happens again 5. Switch the network speed to full and the thumbnail stays the same, but when I click on it, the image loads ## Expected Result: Image loads. ## Actual Result: Image broken and displayed error "Attachment not found" in chat. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.2.1-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** No
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/64255
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ndk.2303+new172@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Device used:** Android 16 / Pixel 7A
**App Component:** Chat Report View

## Action Performed:
Precondition: User B send message to User A
1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Go offline
3. User A, navigate to User B's convo
4. Right click on the message -> Flag as Offensive -> Harrassment
5. Navigate to LHN
6. Go online

## Expected Result:
LHN does not show the flagged message

## Actual Result:
LHN shows the flagged message again after back to to online.

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Device used:** Mac 14.5/ Chrome
**App Component:** User Settings

## Action Performed:
Prerequisite: Be on account that has global reimbursements beta enabled

1. Create a EUR, CAD, GBP or AUD workspace
2. Go to Workflows tab and press on Connect bank account
3. Go through the flow up to Step 5
4. In step 5 select that you're not a director and click on 'confirm' button 
5. Notice that in the "Signer Page" The email field is not focused

## Expected Result:
Email filed is focused

## Actual Result:
Email filed is not focused

## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.2.1-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** No
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/66890
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Device used:** Windows 11 / Chrome. Android 13 / Xiaomi Poco F5, Android 13 / Chrome, macOS 14.5 / MacBook Air 2020
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
- At least have a workspace

1. Login to ND
2. Submit an expense on the workspace chat
3. Go to the Reports, reports load fine without issue
4. Go to Account > Troubleshoot > Clear cache and restart > Reset and refresh
5. Go to Inbox > Workspace > Reports
6. Verify that the reports load infinitely

## Expected Result:
Reports can be load without any issues

## Actual Result:
Reports load infinitely after reset app, open Inbox -> Workspace, then open Report
Note:
- Not reproduce on iOS environment

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [x] Android: App
- [x] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari
